snippet: Federal authorities say State Senator Malcolm A. Smith swapped road improvements for a ballot spot in the Republican primary for mayor in New York.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes Democratic State Sen Malcolm A Smith, accused by federal authorities of swapping road improvements in Rockland County for spot on ballot in Republican primary for mayor in New York City, remains picture of calm in court; says Smith  has been swinging like a shutter in a hurricane for much of last decade, seated along hinges of power in Albany.
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities say State Senator Malcolm A. Smith swapped road improvements for a ballot spot in the Republican primary for mayor in New York.

headline.seo: Malcolm Smith Accused of Bribery for Spot on Mayoral Ballot
headline.main: Jumping From Party to Party to Bribery Charge
headline.print_headline: Jumping From Party To Party To Bribery
